caption: Thank you to all who have served in our military and continue to serve. #BruinsSalute
caption_raw: Thank you to all who have served in our military and continue to serve. #BruinsSalute

caption: What an awesome story from Military Appreciation Night!  Jimmy Hayes donated tickets for military families.   Holly Sullivan, Master Sergeant at Hanscom Air Force Base, and her husband, Wade (retired from the Air Force), ended up coming to the game with those tickets.   Sullivan bid on Hayes  camouflage jersey he wore during warmups, and a family from Dorchester helped her win it.   So, here we are, with Holly getting to meet Jimmy, and her husband laughing,  I haven t seen her smile like this in a looong time!  #BruinsSalute
caption_raw: What an awesome story from Military Appreciation Night! 🇺🇸Jimmy Hayes donated tickets for military families. ➡️ Holly Sullivan, Master Sergeant at Hanscom Air Force Base, and her husband, Wade (retired from the Air Force), ended up coming to the game with those tickets. ➡️ Sullivan bid on Hayes’ camouflage jersey he wore during warmups, and a family from Dorchester helped her win it. ➡️ So, here we are, with Holly getting to meet Jimmy, and her husband laughing, “I haven’t seen her smile like this in a looong time!” #BruinsSalute

Prior to tonight's game, #NHLBruins became the first NHL team/North American pro sports team to partner with Beijing's O.R.G. Packaging.

caption:
The #NHLBruins and Canadiens will autograph and auction their game-worn jerseys from tonight s contest in Montreal with all proceeds going to support Boston Pride forward Denna Laing in her rehabilitation and recovery from the injury she suffered while playing in the Outdoor Women s Classic. 

Each player will sign his game-worn jersey, which will be put up for bid on the League s official auction site: auctions.nhl.com/DennaLaing.
 
Bidding will begin at 7:05 p.m. ET.
caption_raw:
The #NHLBruins and Canadiens will autograph and auction their game-worn jerseys from tonight’s contest in Montreal with all proceeds going to support Boston Pride forward Denna Laing in her rehabilitation and recovery from the injury she suffered while playing in the Outdoor Women’s Classic. 

Each player will sign his game-worn jersey, which will be put up for bid on the League’s official auction site: auctions.nhl.com/DennaLaing.

caption:
The Boston Bruins announced that the Jacobs Family, the Boston Bruins, the Boston Bruins Foundation and TD Garden have pledged a minimum donation of $200,000 to help support Boston Pride forward Denna Laing.
 
 Over the past few weeks our organization has gotten to know Denna and her family, and we have all been inspired by their positive attitudes and Denna s fighting spirit,  said CEO for Delaware North s Boston Holdings Charlie Jacobs.   As leaders in the New England hockey community we want to help with Denna's recovery and rehab and this is our first step in what will be continuing support for the Laing family. 
 
Individuals who are interested in donating directly to Laing s fund should visit dennalaing.org. For more information, please visit bostonbruins.com.
caption_raw:
The Boston Bruins announced that the Jacobs Family, the Boston Bruins, the Boston Bruins Foundation and TD Garden have pledged a minimum donation of $200,000 to help support Boston Pride forward Denna Laing.
 
“Over the past few weeks our organization has gotten to know Denna and her family, and we have all been inspired by their positive attitudes and Denna’s fighting spirit,” said CEO for Delaware North’s Boston Holdings Charlie Jacobs.  “As leaders in the New England hockey community we want to help with Denna's recovery and rehab and this is our first step in what will be continuing support for the Laing family.”
 
Individuals who are interested in donating directly to Laing’s fund should visit dennalaing.org. For more information, please visit bostonbruins.com.

caption: In honor of Military Appreciation Night, tonight s ceremonial puck drop was performed by Colonel Benjamin T. Watson who has served in multiple combat tours including Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom and is the current Commander of Marine Barracks, Washington, DC. Colonel Watson s personal decorations include the Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star Medal with combat distinguishing device, Meritorious Service Medal with gold star, Navy/Marine Corps Commendation Medal with two gold stars, and Combat Action Ribbon with a gold star. #BruinsSalute
caption_raw: In honor of Military Appreciation Night, tonight’s ceremonial puck drop was performed by Colonel Benjamin T. Watson who has served in multiple combat tours including Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom and is the current Commander of Marine Barracks, Washington, DC. Colonel Watson’s personal decorations include the Defense Superior Service Medal, Bronze Star Medal with combat distinguishing device, Meritorious Service Medal with gold star, Navy/Marine Corps Commendation Medal with two gold stars, and Combat Action Ribbon with a gold star. #BruinsSalute

caption: David Krejci was named the @nhl Third Star for the month of October. Krejci carried a nine game point streak throughout the month of October (7-8=15 totals). The centerman s 15 points are good for third in the NHL while his 7 goals are tied for third in the league.

caption: On Monday, the NHL announced that Brad Marchand had been named the first star of the week for the week ending Nov. 1. Marchand posted six points last week (4-2=6) with a plus-three rating, including three consecutive two-point games against Arizona on October 27, Florida on October 30 and Tampa Bay on October 31.  Marchand s two goal performance against the Panthers in Sunrise included the team s game-winner. #NHLBruins
caption_raw: On Monday, the NHL announced that Brad Marchand had been named the first star of the week for the week ending Nov. 1. Marchand posted six points last week (4-2=6) with a plus-three rating, including three consecutive two-point games against Arizona on October 27, Florida on October 30 and Tampa Bay on October 31.  Marchand’s two goal performance against the Panthers in Sunrise included the team’s game-winner. #NHLBruins

They did it in 10.47 seconds! #HockeyFightsCancer

caption: Before today's game, #NHLBruins President Cam Neely and General Manager Don Sweeney signed Travis Roy to a one-day Bruins contract. The Boston Bruins Foundation and Boston Bruins Alumni Association also presented a $50,000 donation to the Travis Roy Foundation, which is dedicated to enhancing the lives of individuals with spinal cord injuries and their families. The Travis Roy Foundation was established in 1997 to help spinal cord injury survivors and to fund research into a cure.

The Boston Bruins Foundation and Boston Bruins Alumni Association also presented a $50,000 donation to the Travis Roy Foundation, which is dedicated to enhancing the lives of individuals with spinal cord injuries and their families. The Travis Roy Foundation was established in 1997 to help spinal cord injury survivors and to fund research into a cure.

caption: Patrice Bergeron is teaming up with 98.5 The Sports Hub and the 2014-15 #NHLBruins roster for the 8th annual "Cuts for a Cause" on March 24.  For the first time ever, Bergeron and all twenty-three of his teammates will have their heads shaved by auction winners to show their support and raise money for the Boston Bruins Foundation and Floating Hospital for Children at Tufts Medical Center. Fan can bid on the opportunity to shave the head of their favorite participating Bruins player by visiting bostonbruins.com/cutsforacause. Bidding begins at 10AM today!
caption_raw: Patrice Bergeron is teaming up with 98.5 The Sports Hub and the 2014-15 #NHLBruins roster for the 8th annual "Cuts for a Cause" on March 24.  For the first time ever, Bergeron and all twenty-three of his teammates will have their heads shaved by auction winners to show their support and raise money for the Boston Bruins Foundation and Floating Hospital for Children at Tufts Medical Center. Fan can bid on the opportunity to shave the head of their favorite participating Bruins player by visiting bostonbruins.com/cutsforacause. Bidding begins at 10AM today!

caption:
The NHL announced Monday that Boston Bruins goaltender Tuukka Rask has been named Third Star of the Month for the month of January.

Rask only had one regulation loss in the month of January, going 7-1-3, including a shutout performance against the New York Rangers on January 15 where the netminder stopped all 30 shots he saw.  Rask appeared in 11 games in January, allowing 18 goals, giving him a 1.64 goals against average. In total, the 27-year-old Finnish netminder made 336 saves on 354 shots last month for a .949 save percentage. For the full release head to BostonBruins.com.
caption_raw:
The NHL announced Monday that Boston Bruins goaltender Tuukka Rask has been named Third Star of the Month for the month of January.

Rask only had one regulation loss in the month of January, going 7-1-3, including a shutout performance against the New York Rangers on January 15 where the netminder stopped all 30 shots he saw.  Rask appeared in 11 games in January, allowing 18 goals, giving him a 1.64 goals against average. In total, the 27-year-old Finnish netminder made 336 saves on 354 shots last month for a .949 save percentage. For the full release head to BostonBruins.com.

caption:
#NHLBruins have signed Head Coach Claude Julien to a multi-year contract extension.

Head to BostonBruins.com and the Bruins Mobile App to read the official release. The terms of the extension were finalized this morning.

GM Peter Chiarelli, in a statement: "He has coached the Bruins to a Stanley Cup and a Cup Final appearance and our goal to win with him at the helm remains the same as we move forward.

#NHLBruins have signed Head Coach Claude Julien to a multi-year contract extension.

caption:
Boston Bruins Principal Charlie Jacobs and President Cam Neely issued the following statements regarding the passing of Mayor Thomas M. Menino: 
Charlie Jacobs:
 I was saddened today to learn of the passing of Mayor Menino and on behalf of the Jacobs Family I would like to express my deepest condolences to his family. My family and I witnessed first hand how Mayor Menino's vision and leadership helped transform Boston into one of the greatest cities in the world. Today we join all Bostonians in mourning our loss and celebrating Mayor Menino's enduring legacy." Cam Neely:
 The Boston Bruins organization is deeply saddened by the passing of Mayor Menino and we would like to express our deepest condolences to his family. Mayor Menino was synonymous with the City of Boston and the professional sports teams that represented it. His passion was always evident and his support unwavering. He will be deeply missed.
caption_raw:
Boston Bruins Principal Charlie Jacobs and President Cam Neely issued the following statements regarding the passing of Mayor Thomas M. Menino: 
Charlie Jacobs:
“I was saddened today to learn of the passing of Mayor Menino and on behalf of the Jacobs Family I would like to express my deepest condolences to his family. My family and I witnessed first hand how Mayor Menino's vision and leadership helped transform Boston into one of the greatest cities in the world. Today we join all Bostonians in mourning our loss and celebrating Mayor Menino's enduring legacy." Cam Neely:
“The Boston Bruins organization is deeply saddened by the passing of Mayor Menino and we would like to express our deepest condolences to his family. Mayor Menino was synonymous with the City of Boston and the professional sports teams that represented it. His passion was always evident and his support unwavering. He will be deeply missed.”
